pageProps.content:
![Baengnokdam Lake (한라산 백록담)](/2022-07-19-1658206116289/1632499_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Baengnokdam is a crater lake that sits on top of Hallasan Mountain at the center of Jeju Island. It spans 3 kilometers in circumference and 500 meters in diameter, and is surrounded by approximately 360 parasitic cones. At the peak, visitors can feel like floating on clouds. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|• 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
• For more info: +82-64-713-9950~3| |parking:|Available| |restdate:|N/A (Open all year round)| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Mountain Not Access Period:|[Seongpanak Trail]
May-August: Seongpanak Trail Entrance & Azalea Shelter restricted from 13:00
November-February: Trail entrance starting from 06:00, Seonpanak Trail & Azalea Shelter restricted from 12:00, Baengnokdam restricted from 13:30

[Gwaneumsa Temple Trail]
May-August: Gwaneumsa Temple Trail Entrance & Samgakbong Shelter restricted from 13:00
November-February: Trail entrance starting from 06:00, Gwaneumsa Temple Trail & Samgakbong Shelter restricted from 12:00, Baengnokdam restricted from 13:30| |Hiking Course:|[Seongpanak Trail]
Seongpanak Visitors Center→Sokbat Shelter→Saraakoreum Entrance→Azalea Field Shelter→Dongneung Peak

[Gwaneumsa Temple Trail]
Gwaneumsa→Tamnagyegok Valley→Gaemimok→Samgakbong Shelter→Dongneung Peak| |Admission Fees:|Free| |Parking Fees:|- Two-wheel vehicles: 500 won
- Small vehicles (displacement less than 1,000 cc): 1,000 won
- Cars (loading capacity less than 4 tons): 1,800 won
- Small bus (11-15 passengers): 3,000 won
- Mid/Large bus (more than 16 passengers): 3,700 won| |Restrooms:|Available| ## Contact - [☎️+82-64-713-9950](tel:+82647139950) - [🏠www.jeju.go.kr/hallasan](http://www.jeju.go.kr/hallasan/index.htm) ```googleMap latitude: 33.3444755049 longitude: 126.5364394223 title: Topyeong-dong, Seogwipo-si, Jejudo ``` ## Directions [Bus]
From Jeju Intercity Bus Terminal, take Bus No. 781 or 781-1 and get off at Seongpanak Bus Stop.

data.title: Baengnokdam Lake (한라산 백록담)
data.description: Baengnokdam is a crater lake that sits on top of Hallasan Mountain at the center of Jeju Island. It spans 3 kilometers in circumference and 500 meters in diameter, and is surrounded by approximately 360 parasitic cones. At the peak, visitors can feel like floating on clouds.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Biyangdo Island (비양도)
dataList.description: Meaning “to fly over,” Biyangdo Island is the last-formed volcanic island in Jeju (1002). It remains in its original form as a parasitic volcano and it is located in the center of an uncontaminated area of the sea having abundant fishing grounds with varied fish species. The island has many natural formations, including Biyangbong Peak, featuring six mysterious peaks, two craters, and a rock formed like a mom carrying her baby on her back. The island has many walking paths to view these attractions and more.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Bijarim Forest (비자림)
dataList.description:
Designated Natural Monument No. 374, Bijarim Forest is a group of about 2,800 nutmeg yew trees between 500 and 800 years old. The trees measure 7-14 meters in x_height and 50-110 centimeters in diameter, with canopy spread of 10-15 meters. In the past, the trees were harvested for pine nuts, as well as used for the construction of quality furniture and baduk game boards.

In addition to the large colony of nutmeg yew, the forest is also home to many rare orchid species. The trees emit a lot of phytoncide, which is said to strengthen the immune system and boost the natural healing ability of the human body. Nearby attractions include volcanic cones like Abuoreum and Yongnunioruem, perfect for a more energetic walk and a view of Bijarim Forest from above.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Andeokgyegok Valley (안덕계곡)
dataList.description: Andeokgyegok Valley in Gamsan-ri Village is located 2 kilometers east of Hwasun-ri. The valley is filled with many species of pine trees that make up the Evergreen Forest, designated as Natural Monument No. 377. The road from the entrance to the waterfall offers a picturesque scenery. The view at night, when lit by nothing but the stars in the sky, is nothing short of spectacular.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Altteureu Airfield & Japanese Occupation-Era Hangars (알뜨르비행장 및 일본군 비행기 격납고)
dataList.description: The airfield was built by Jeju-do residents under force by the Japanese army during the Second World War. Visitors can explore the airfield, the control tower, an anti-aircraft emplacement and a hangar at the site. There are relics of the Japanese army and tragic relics of Korea's modern history at 4.3 Historic Site and Jinji Cave in the vicinity to Songaksan Mountain and close to the airfield.
dataList.author: korea-tour
